title: San Diego/Downtown
name: Park at the Park
address: south of J Street between Seventh and Tenth Avenue
content: For the 81 Padres home game days, this grassy berm overlooking PETCO Park is closed to the general public, open as a place to view the game for the price of a ticket. But for the other 284 days of the year, the park is open to the public. The park has a small baseball diamond, a playground, and there are various monuments to the achievements of the Padres, such as a statue of star player Tony Gwynn nearby.
